Hemoglobin.simple: Hemoglobin carries oxygen in your blood.
Hemoglobin.label: Hemoglobin

WBC.simple: White blood cells help fight infections.
WBC.label: White Blood Cells (WBC)

Platelets.simple: Platelets help your blood to clot when needed.
Platelets.label: Platelets

Glucose (Fasting).simple: Fasting glucose shows sugar level after not eating.
Glucose (Fasting).label: Fasting Glucose

Total Cholesterol.simple: Total cholesterol is the sum of fats in your blood.
Total Cholesterol.label: Total Cholesterol

LDL.simple: LDL is the 'bad' cholesterol that can build up in arteries.
LDL.label: LDL Cholesterol

HDL.simple: HDL is the 'good' cholesterol that helps remove extra fat.
HDL.label: HDL Cholesterol

Triglycerides.simple: Triglycerides are another type of fat in your blood.
Triglycerides.label: Triglycerides

ALT.simple: ALT is a liver enzyme; higher levels can mean irritation.
ALT.label: ALT (Alanine transaminase)

AST.simple: AST is a liver enzyme; checked with ALT for context.
AST.label: AST (Aspartate transaminase)

TSH.simple: TSH is a signal from the brain that guides thyroid activity.
TSH.label: TSH

Creatinine.simple: Creatinine helps estimate how well your kidneys filter blood.
Creatinine.label: Creatinine

BUN.simple: BUN is a waste product; kidneys remove it from blood.
BUN.label: BUN (Blood Urea Nitrogen)

Sodium.simple: Sodium is a mineral that helps with fluid balance.
Sodium.label: Sodium

Potassium.simple: Potassium supports muscles and heart rhythm.
Potassium.label: Potassium

Calcium.simple: Calcium builds bones and supports nerves and muscles.
Calcium.label: Calcium
